sen.j: 綾小路家（あやのこうじけ）は宇多源氏の流れを汲む源氏堂上源氏。
sen.e: The Ayanokoji family is a member of Genji Tosho Genji (the Minamoto clan members who are court nobles above a certain rank), who is a descendant of Uda-Genji (the Minamoto clan).
The Ayanokoji family was a member of Genji Tosho Genji (Minamoto clan members who are court nobles above a certain rank), a descendant of Uda-Genji (the Minamoto clan).
The Ayanokoji family was a member of Genji Tosho Genji (Minamoto clan members who are court nobles above a certain rank), descendants of Uda-Genji (Minamoto clan).
sen.cmt: 用語共有に沿って the Minamoto clan →Minamoto clanに修正a decendant → decendants

sen.j: 左大臣・源雅信の子孫綾小路信有（正二位・中納言）（1269年 - 1324年）を祖とする。
sen.e: Its patriarch was Nobuari AYANOKOJI (Shonii (Senior Second Rank), Chunagon (vice-councilor pf state)) (1269 - 1324), a descendant of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) MINAMOTO no Masanobu.
Its patriarch was Nobuari AYANOKOJI (Shonii - Senior Second Rank), Chunagon (vice-councilor pf state) (1269 - 1324), a descendant of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) MINAMOTO no Masanobu.
Its patriarch was Nobuari AYANOKOJI (Shonii - Senior Second Rank), Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) (1269 - 1324), a descendant of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) MINAMOTO no Masanobu.

sen.j: ちなみに兄は庭田家の祖庭田経資（正二位・中納言）（1241年 - 没年未詳）である。
sen.e: Incidentally, his older brother was the patriarch of the Niwata family, Tsunesuke NIWATA (Shonii, Chunagon) (1241 - year of death unknown).
Incidentally, his older brother was the patriarch of the Niwata family, Tsunesuke NIWATA (Shonii, Chunagon) (1241 - year of death unknown).
Incidentally, his older brother was the patriarch of the Niwata family, Tsunesuke NIWATA (Shonii, Chunagon) (1241 - year of death unknown).
The family rank was Urinke (family of court nobles whose members were allowed to be promoted to higher court positions).
The family rank was Urinke (family of court nobles whose members were allowed to be promoted to higher court positions).
The family rank was the House of Urin.
sen.cmt: 用語共有に沿って 修正

sen.e: The highest court rank originally appointed was Chunagon.
The highest court rank originally appointed was Chunagon.
The highest court rank originally appointed was Chunagon.

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)の綾小路俊量（正二位・中納言）（1451年 - 1518年）以降中絶。
sen.e: The family ended after Toshikazu AYANOKOJI (Shonii, Chunagon) (1451 - 1518) from the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan).
The family ended after Toshikazu AYANOKOJI (Shonii, Chunagon) (1451 - 1518) from the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan).
The family ended after Toshikazu AYANOKOJI (Shonii, Chunagon) (1451 - 1518) from the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan).

sen.j: 慶長18年（1613年）に五辻家から綾小路高有（正三位・参議）（1595年 - 1644年）が入り家名再興。
sen.e: In 1613, Takaari AYANOKOJI (Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank), Sangi (Councilor)) (1595 - 1644) joined the family from the Gojo family, and the family name was revived.
In 1613, Takaari AYANOKOJI (Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank), Sangi (Councilor)) (1595 - 1644) joined the family from the Gojo family, and the family name was revived.
In 1613, Takaari AYANOKOJI (Shosanmi - Senior Third Rank), Sangi - Councilor) (1595 - 1644) joined the family from the Gojo family, and the family name was revived.
sen.cmt: 前段のpunctuation修正例に沿って、修正。

sen.j: そして綾小路俊宗（1690年 - 1770年）以降は大納言を極官とする。
sen.e: After Toshimune AYANOKOJI (1690 - 1770), the highest court position appointed was Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
After Toshimune AYANOKOJI (1690 - 1770), the highest court position appointed was Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
After Toshimune AYANOKOJI (1690 - 1770), the highest court position appointed was Dainagon (chief councilor of state).

sen.j: 雅楽の中で郢曲や和琴・箏・笛関する知識は庭田家ではなく綾小路家に伝わった。
sen.e: The knowledge of eikyoku (a type of old Japanese song), wagon (Japanese harp), so (a long Japanese zither with thirteen strings) and fue (Japanese flute) among gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) was passed down in the Ayanokoji family instead of the Niwata family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The knowledge of eikyoku (a type of old Japanese song), wagon (Japanese harp), so (a long Japanese zither with thirteen strings) and fue (Japanese flute) among gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) was passed down in the Ayanokoji family instead of the Niwata family.

The knowledge of eikyoku (a type of old Japanese song), wagon (Japanese harp), so (a long Japanese zither with thirteen strings) and fue (Japanese flute) among gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) was passed down in the Ayanokoji family instead of the Niwata family.

sen.j: そのために、以降は雅楽の師範家として朝廷に仕えることとなる。
sen.e: Therefore, since then, the family served the Imperial Court as the gagaku master.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since then, the family served the Imperial Court as the gagaku master.
Since then, the family served the Imperial Court as the gagaku master.
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was 200 koku.
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was 200 koku.
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was 200 koku.
The family status after the Meiji period is that of a viscount.
The family status after the Meiji period was viscount.
The family status after the Meiji period was viscount.
